page.title: 20FARMING IN STOCKSBRIDGE
page.content: CASTLE FARM AT BOLSTERSTONE IS A TYPICAL MIXED FARM, IN THIS AREA, OF 84 ACRES. MR. WEBSTER, THE OWNER, HAS A HERD OF 40 PEDIGREE FRIESIAN COWS CALLED 'THE CATTLESTONE HERD' WHICH PRODUCES ABOUT 600 LITRES OF MILK A DAY. SOME MILK IS BOTTLED AND SOLD LOCALLY, SOME FED TO THE CALVES AND THE REST COLLECTED BY TANKER AND TAKEN TO THE LOCAL DAIRY. HE ALSO KEEP HENS AND ABOUT 280 EGGS ARE SOLD LOCALLY EVER DAY. MOST OF HIS LAND IS USED FOR GRAZING OR HAY. ABOUT 10 ACRES ARE USED FOR GROWING MAINLY BARLEY WITH SOME POTATOES, FODDER BEET, SWEDES AND KALE. ANOTHER FARM HAS A FLOCK OF 100 EWES WHICH HAVE PRODUCED 183 LAMBS. 50 ACRES OF BARLEY AND 70 ACRES OF GRASS FOR SILAGE ARE GROWN THE LATTER OF WHICH IS CROPPED 3 TIMES A YEAR. 20 ACRES OF HAY ARE ALSO GROWN.
